title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says that several spells of showers will occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, and North-western provinces and in Nuwara Eliya, Kandy, Galle, and Matara districts today (05).

title: Texas floods death toll rises to 24, more than 20 children missing
byline: Months worth of heavy rain fell in a matter of hours on Texas Hill Country, leaving 24 people dead and many more unaccounted for Friday, including more than 20 girls attending a summer camp, as search teams conducted boat and helicopter rescues in fast-moving floodwaters.

title: At least 13 killed and 20 children missing in Texas floods
byline: Thirteen people have died in Kerr County in the US state of Texas, according to authorities, after severe weather and flooding hit parts of the state.

title: Authorities clarify reason behind travel warning to Meemure
byline: Kandy District Secretary Indika Udawatta has announced the temporary closure of the Kaikawala Bridge on the Hunnasgiriya-Meemure road due to ongoing repair work.

title: Hamas says it delivered ‘positive response’ on Gaza ceasefire plan
byline: Hamas says it has delivered a “positive response” to mediators on the latest proposal for a new Gaza ceasefire and hostage release deal put forward by the US.

title: ‘Fantastic Four’ actor Julian McMahon dies after cancer battle
byline: Julian McMahon, the Australian actor known for roles in the TV series Nip/Tuck, Charmed, Profiler and FBI: Most Wanted, and the film Fantastic Four, died on July 2 in Clearwater, Florida following a private battle with cancer.

title: Sudden security operation launched in Ragama, Kandana, and Wattala
byline: Security forces, including the Sri Lanka Army, Navy, Special Task Force (STF), and Police, were urgently deployed to the Ragama, Kandana, and Wattala areas last night (04) in response to recent incidents of violence.

title: Two more arrested over Borella shooting incident
byline: Two suspects have been arrested in connection with the shooting of an individual with a T56 firearm in the Halgahakumbura area, within the Borella Police Division.

title: Over 300 suspects involved in illegal activities arrested in special joint operation
byline: Over 300 individuals involved in illegal drug-related and other unlawful activities were arrested during a special large-scale search operation jointly conducted by the Sri Lanka Police, the Special Task Force (STF), the Sri Lanka Army, the Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF), and the Sri Lanka Navy.

title: Youth attacked to death with sharp weapon in Mahiyanganaya
byline: Two individuals were attacked with a sharp weapon in the Gurumada area of Mahiyanganaya, resulting in the death of one person.

title: Space capsule holding over 160 people’s ashes lost at sea after crash
byline: The human remains of over 160 people who wanted to float in space after their deaths have now crashed at sea after the space capsule holding them fell into the Pacific Ocean.

title: Trump signs ‘big, beautiful’ bill on US Independence Day
byline: US President Donald Trump signed his flagship tax and spending bill into law on Friday, July 4, capping a pomp-laden White House Independence Day ceremony featuring a stealth bomber fly-by.

title: 18 injured after fire breaks out on Ryanair plane at Spanish airport
byline: Eighteen people sustained minor injuries after a fire broke out on a Ryanair plane shortly after midnight at Majorca’s Palma de Mallorca Airport, prompting a swift evacuation and emergency response.

title: Man arrested over multiple financial frauds using forged payment receipts
byline: An individual has been arrested for committing multiple financial frauds to the tune of hundreds of thousands of rupees by presenting forged payment receipts, and falsely claiming to have made payments for goods ordered via mobile phone.

title: Kamal Haasan restrained by Bengaluru court from making defamatory remarks on Kannada
byline: Actor Kamal Haasan’s ‘Kannada was born out of Tamil’ remark continues to cause multiple ripple effects.

title: 100 ‘Suposha’ outlets to be established nationwide
byline: Sri Lanka Thriposha Limited (SLTL) has announced plans to establish 100 ‘Suposha’ outlets across the country in the near future.

title: Wildfires break out in Turkey, Syria and Greece - with towns near Athens evacuated
byline: Wildfires have broken out on an island and in towns near Athens in Greece, with blazes also being sparked in Turkey and Syria.

title: CBSL further extends Perpetual Treasuries’ suspension
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has decided to extend the suspension of Perpetual Treasuries Limited (PTL) from carrying on the business and activities of a Primary Dealer for a further period of six months.

title: Special search operations launched in several areas to continue
byline: The Ministry of Defence says that the special search operations initiated in Ragama, Kandana and Wattala areas will be carried out further.

title: Death toll in Texas floods rises to at least 27 as search continues for many missing, officials say
byline: Crews searched through the dark early Saturday for two dozen children from a girls’ camp and many others who were still missing after a wall of water rushed down a river in the Texas Hill Country during a powerful storm that killed at least 27 people.

title: ‘Harak Kata’ admitted to Colombo National Hospital
byline: Nadun Chinthaka Wickremeratne, alias ‘Harak Kata’, the notorious underworld figure currently in the custody of the Terrorism Investigation Division (TID), has been admitted to the Colombo National Hospital for medical treatment.
